clinical_study.brief_title: Transbronchial Mediastinal Cryobiopsy Combined With EBUS-TBNA in the Diagnosis of Mediastinal Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: The Study for Diagnostic Value and Safety of Transbronchial Mediastinal Cryobiopsy Combined With EBUS-TBNA in Mediastinal Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: The clinical study is aimed to investigate the diagnostic efficacy and safety of a novel less-invasive method, endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial mediastinal cryobiopsy (EBUS-TBMCB), to sample mediastinal lesions.

detailed_description.textblock: A traditional method, endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration (EBUS-TBNA) and another emerging method, transbronchial forceps biopsy (TBFB) were both used to be compared. The patients involved were randomly divided into two groups. In the experimental group, EBUS-TBMCB was performed following EBUS-TBNA while in other two groups, EBUS-TBNA or EBUS-TBNA and EBUS-TBFB were performed respectively. The samples obtained in the three groups were analyzed by the pathologists. Patients were followed up for confirming the diagnosis and complications. The diagnostic accuracy and prevalence of complications were compared among the three groups.
